title: Quincy Dodd
text:
Quincy Dodd (born 13 April 2000) is an Australian <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays for the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Sydney Roosters</a> in the <a href="NRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">NRL Women's Premiership</a> and the <a href="Cronulla-Sutherland%20Sharks">Cronulla-Sutherland Sharks</a> in the <a href="NSWRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">NSWRL Women's Premiership</a>.
A or , she is a <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20women%27s%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales</a> representative.
Background.
Dodd was born in <a href="Kogarah%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Kogarah, New South Wales</a> and is a <a href="Cronulla-Caringbah%20Junior%20Rugby%20League%20Football%20Club">Cronulla-Caringbah</a> junior.
Playing career.
In 2017 and 2018, Dodd played for the <a href="Cronulla-Sutherland%20Sharks">Cronulla-Sutherland Sharks</a> <a href="Tarsha%20Gale%20Cup">Tarsha Gale Cup</a> side, who were coached by her father, Colin. 
In May 2018, Dodd represented NSW City at the Women's National Championships. In June 2018, she was 18th player for <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20women%27s%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales</a>. 
In September 2018, she joined the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Sydney Roosters</a> <a href="NRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">NRL Women's Premiership</a> squad but did not play a game. On 6 October 2018, she represented the <a href="Prime%20Minister%27s%20XIII">Prime Minister's XIII</a> in their win over <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea%20women%27s%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Papua New Guinea</a>.
2019.
On 15 February, Dodd started at for the <a href="Indigenous%20All%20Stars%20%28rugby%20league%29">Indigenous All Stars</a> in their 4–8 loss to the Maori All Stars. In June, she represented NSW City at the Women's National Championships.
In Round 3 of the <a href="2019%20NRL%20Women%27s%20season">2019 NRL Women's season</a>, Dodd made her NRLW debut for the Roosters in their 16–24 loss to the <a href="St%20George%20Illawarra%20Dragons">St George Illawarra Dragons</a>. On 11 October, Dodd started at for the Prime Minister's XIII in their 22–14 win over the Fiji Prime Minister's XIII.
2020.
On 22 February, Dodd came off the bench in the Indigenous All Stars 10–4 win over the Maori All Stars. In March, Dodd joined the <a href="Canterbury-Bankstown%20Bulldogs">Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs</a> <a href="NSWRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">NSWRL Women's Premiership</a> team.
On 25 October, Dodd came off the bench and scored a try in the Roosters' 10–20 NRLW Grand Final loss to the <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane Broncos</a>. On 13 November, Dodd made her <a href="Women%27s%20State%20of%20Origin">State of Origin</a> debut for <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20women%27s%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales</a> in their 18–24 loss to <a href="Queensland%20women%27s%20rugby%20league%20team">Queensland</a>.
2021.
On 20 February, Dodd represented the <a href="Indigenous%20All%20Stars%20%28rugby%20league%29">Indigenous All Stars</a> for the third time, in their 24–0 loss to the <a href="New%20Zealand%20M%C4%81ori%20rugby%20league%20team">Māori All Stars</a>. In March, she rejoined the Sharks for the 2021 NSWRL Women's Premierhsip season.
